<h3 id="X24474">X(24474)&nbsp;=&nbsp;  X(1)X(3)&cap;X(2)X(5761)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a (a^5 b-a^4 b^2-2 a^3 b^3+2 a^2 b^4+a b^5-b^6+a^5 c-2 a^4 b c-a b^4 c+2 b^5 c-a^4 c^2+b^4 c^2-2 a^3 c^3-4 b^3 c^3+2 a^2 c^4-a b c^4+b^2 c^4+a c^5+2 b c^5-c^6) : :
<p>
See Antreas Hatzipolakis and Peter Moses, <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=28407"> <b>Hyacinthos 28407</b></a>.
</p>
<p>
Let A'B'C' be the orthic triangle.  Let L<sub>A</sub> be the reflection of line B'C' in the internal angle bisector of A, and define L<sub>B</sub> and L<sub>C</sub> cyclically.  Let A" = L<sub>B</sub>&cap;L<sub>C</sub> and define B" and C" cyclically.  X(24474) = X(3)-of-A"B"C".  (Randy Hutson, November 30, 2018)
</p>
<p>
X(24474) lies on these lines: {1,3}, {2,5761}, {4,912}, {5,72}, {7,6850}, {8,6826}, {10,6881}, {19,3211}, {20,13369}, {28,110}, {30,1071}, {34,3157}, {37,5755}, {52,1866}, {63,3560}, {68,5130}, </p>
<p>
X(24474) = reflection of X(3) in X(942)<br>
X(24474) = anticomplement of X(31837)<br>
</p>
